snippet: Vladimir V. Nesterets, an engineer at a space facility, was sentenced to 13 years in prison on Friday for giving classified information to the C.I.A, according to Russian officials.
abstract: Russian military court sentences engineer Vladimir V Nesterets to 13 years in prison for passing on classified military information to the Central Intelligence Agency; Nesterets worked at a space facility primarily used for military rocket launchings and ballistic missile research.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Vladimir V. Nesterets, an engineer at a space facility, was sentenced to 13 years in prison on Friday for giving classified information to the C.I.A, according to Russian officials.

headline.seo: Russia Convicts Engineer of Passing Secrets to U.S.
headline.main: Russia Convicts Engineer of Passing Secrets to U.S.
headline.print_headline: Russian Convicted of Passing Secrets to U.S.
